item.text: After twenty years, during which Solomon built the Lord’s temple and his royal palace,

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">rebuilt</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="02361" class="">Huram</st><n id="1" /> had <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">him</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">settled</st> <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.
<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="02578" class="">Hamath Zobah</st> and <st data-num="02388 05921">seized</st> it.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">built up</st> <st data-num="08412" class="">Tadmor</st> in the <st data-num="04057" class="">wilderness</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04543" class="">storage</st> <st data-num="05892 0834">cities</st> he had <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> in <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>.

He <st data-num="01129" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05945" class="">upper</st> <st data-num="01032" class="">Beth Horon</st> and <st data-num="08481" class="">lower</st> <st data-num="01032" class="">Beth Horon</st> <st data-num="04692" class="">fortified</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> with <st data-num="02346" class="">walls</st> and <st data-num="01280" class="">barred</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">gates</st>,<n id="1" />

and built up Baalath, all the storage cities that belonged to him, and all the cities where chariots and horses were kept. He built whatever he wanted in Jerusalem, Lebanon, and throughout his entire kingdom.
Now several non-Israelite peoples were left in the land after the conquest of Joshua, including the Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.

Their <st data-num="04480 01121 0834">descendants</st> <st data-num="03498 0310">remained</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> (the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> were <st data-num="03808" class="">unable</st> to <st data-num="03615" class="">wipe</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">them</st> <st data-num="03615" class="">out</st>). <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">conscripted</st> them for his <st data-num="04522" class="">work crews</st>, and they continue in that role <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">assign</st> <st data-num="04480 01121 03478 0834">Israelites</st> to these <st data-num="04399" class="">work</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">crews</st>;<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03588 01992">Israelites</st> served as his <st data-num="0376 04421">soldiers</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st>, <st data-num="07991" class="">charioteers</st>, and <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> of his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="06571" class="">forces</st>.<n id="2" />
These men worked for King Solomon as supervisors; there were a total of 250 of them who were in charge of the people.

Solomon moved Pharaoh’s daughter up from the City of David to the palace he had built for her, for he said, “My wife must not live in the palace of King David of Israel, for the places where the ark of the Lord has entered are holy.”
Then Solomon offered burnt sacrifices to the Lord on the altar of the Lord which he had built in front of the temple’s porch.

He observed the <st data-num="03117 03117">daily</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">requirements</st> for <st data-num="05927" class="">sacrifices</st> that <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> had <st data-num="04687" class="">specified</st> for <st data-num="07676" class="">Sabbaths</st>, <st data-num="02320" class="">new moon festivals</st>, and the <st data-num="07969 06471">three</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">annual</st> <st data-num="04150" class="">celebrations</st>—the <st data-num="02282" class="">Feast</st> of <st data-num="04682" class="">Unleavened Bread</st>, the <st data-num="02282" class="">Feast</st> of <st data-num="07620" class="">Weeks</st>, and the <st data-num="02282" class="">Feast</st> of <st data-num="05521" class="">Shelters</st>.<n id="1" />

As his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> had <st data-num="04941" class="">decreed</st>, Solomon<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05975" class="">appointed</st> the <st data-num="04256" class="">divisions</st> of the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> do their <st data-num="05656" class="">assigned tasks</st>, the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levitical</st> <st data-num="05921 04931">orders</st> to <st data-num="01984" class="">lead worship</st> and <st data-num="08334 05048">help</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> with their <st data-num="03117 03117">daily</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">tasks</st>,<n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="04256" class="">divisions</st> of the <st data-num="07778" class="">gatekeepers</st> to serve at their <st data-num="08179" class="">assigned</st> <st data-num="08179" class="">gates</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588 03651">This</st> was <st data-num="04687" class="">what</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> had <st data-num="04687" class="">ordered</st>.<n id="4" />
They did not neglect any detail of the king’s orders pertaining to the priests, Levites, and treasuries.
All the work ordered by Solomon was completed, from the day the foundation of the Lord’s temple was laid until it was finished; the Lord’s temple was completed.
Then Solomon went to Ezion Geber and to Elat on the coast in the land of Edom.

Huram sent him ships and some of his sailors, men who were well acquainted with the sea. They sailed with Solomon’s men to Ophir and took from there 450 talents of gold, which they brought back to King Solomon.
